item.description:

item.title: Ethernet Now Faster and Cheaper Than T1
item.description:
For a long time, T1 lines have been the top choice for bandwidth for small and medium businesses. They are popular for good reason: they are widely available, reliable, secure, dedicated, adaptable, and relatively affordable. While T1 services have many advantages, there’s a way to get even more value: Ethernet, particularly Ethernet over Copper. item.title: Double Bonded T1 Cost and Alternatives
item.description:
Many businesses appreciate their reliable T1 service, but eventually, the 1.5 Mbps bandwidth becomes insufficient. Instead of abandoning T1, companies can opt for double bonded T1 service, which combines two lines to provide 3 Mbps. This bonding is implemented within customer premises equipment, usually a router with two T1 inputs. The bandwidth can be further increased by triple bonding (4.5 Mbps) or quadruple bonding (6 Mbps), up to a practical limit of eight bonded lines for 12 Mbps...
